intro: Bulbocodium neglectum, commonly known as the neglected bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens and botanical collections.
